Description: Two joining fragments of floor of North Ionian pottery plate or dish; underside reserved, with part of a glazed band and a dedicatory graffito; inside slipped white; from outside: metopal band of sets of verticals, some in red, alternating with squares and crosses; band with added red band lined in white; minimal part of floral motif at centre.
Curator's comments: Close to the subsidiary frieze on the plate British Museum 1888,0601,521 but with minor differences. Also very similar to 1924,1201.992-4 (also dedication by Charmes), but not the same plate. '13' in pencil on outside and a paper label with 'list 39' (if it is 'list').
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1230)
